message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of detecting user activity and single information bit per packet in a grant-free random access cellular network. This involves designing smarter control signaling schemes for efficient use of system resources, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The proposed approach is also applicable to future cellular networks that support a massive number of devices, which is a topic of interest in the networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. The use of machine type communication (MTC) and sensor networks also suggests a connection to the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category. The paper proposes the use of massive MIMO for user detection, which is a topic of interest in the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the proposed approach is based on the approximate message passing (AMP) algorithm, which is a machine learning technique that falls under the category of learning (cs.LG).
